'''Feraligatr''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''オーダイル''' ''Ordile'') is a {{type|Water}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation II]].

It [[Evolution|evolves]] from {{p|Croconaw}} starting at [[level]] 30. It is the final form of {{p|Totodile}}.

==Biology==
Feraligatr is a bulky, bipedal crocodilian Pokémon that is primarily blue with accents of red and yellow. A notable feature of Feraligatr is its large, powerful jaws that are able to bite and lock down on opponents. Three pointed teeth are visible when Feraligatr closes its mouth, two from the lower jaw and one from the upper. Feraligatr intimidates its foes by opening its huge mouth. Feraligatr has three sets of spikes on its body: one on its head, one on its back, and one near the tip of its tail. The one on its back appears particularly prominent, due to its size and the bulk of Feraligatr’s shoulders. It has a bisected, V-shaped yellow pattern between its thighs. Feraligatr also has large scales on its arms, tail, and legs. When hunting or fighting, Feraligatr is agile and fast, due to its powerful hind legs that are used to kick the ground hard and charge. Feraligatr can rarely be found living near {{DL|List of Pokémon by habitat|Water's-edge Pokémon|water}}.

==In the anime==
[[File:Ben Feraligatr.png|thumb|250px|right|Feraligatr in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
===Major appearances===
====[[Wani-Wani]]====
Wani-Wani is a Feraligatr owned by {{jo|Marina}}, which she received in ''[[The Legend of Thunder!]]'' as a {{p|Totodile}}. Its most recent appearance was in ''[[DP041|A Stand-Up Sit-Down!]]''.

====Other====
[[Raiden]] used his Feraligatr in the [[Sumo Conference]] during in ''[[EP194|The Ring Masters]]'', where it battled against a {{p|Golem}} and {{p|Blastoise}} before being defeated by {{Ash}} and his {{AP|Snorlax}}.

A Feraligatr appeared in ''[[EP217|The Perfect Match!]]'', where [[Trinity]] battled it during the [[Whirl Cup]].

A Feraligatr owned by [[Kinso]] appeared in ''[[SS005|The Blue Badge of Courage]]''.

{{ra|Ben}} summoned a Feraligatr twice using [[Ranger Sign]]s in ''[[DP169|Pokémon Ranger: Heatran Rescue!]]''.

===Minor appearances===
Feraligatr debuted in ''[[Trouble in Big Town]]'', where it helped [[Pichu Brothers|Pichu Big]], {{p|Magby}} and {{p|Smoochum}} get out of water.

A Feraligatr appeared in ''[[EP266|A Claim to Flame!]]'', under the ownership of a Trainer participating in a qualifying match for the [[Silver Conference]].

A Feraligatr was used by one of the students of the [[Pokémon Trainers' School]] in ''[[AG015|Gonna Rule The School!]]''. It was seen battling a {{p|Typhlosion}}.

A Feraligatr made a brief cameo appearance in ''[[SS021|Pokémon Mystery Dungeon: Explorers of Sky - Beyond Time & Darkness]]''.

{{an|Brock}} used a Feraligatr in the second leg of the [[Pokémon Triathlon]] in ''[[DP091|One Team, Two Team, Red Team, Blue Team!]]''.

A Feraligatr appeared in the city in [[PK20]].

A {{pkmn|Trainer}}'s Feraligatr appeared in ''[[DP141|Challenging a Towering Figure!]]'', where it battled against [[Ash's Pikachu]] during the {{DL|Twinleaf Festival|Festival Battle Challenge}}.

A Feraligatr appeared in ''[[DP158|Regaining the Home Advantage!]]''.

A Feraligatr appeared in ''[[M16|Genesect and the Legend Awakened]]'' at [[Pokémon Hills]].

===In the Pokémon Adventures manga===
{{main|Silver's Feraligatr}}
In ''[[PS148|Lively Lugia III]]'', {{adv|Silver}}'s Croconaw evolved into Feraligatr to protect {{adv|Gold}}, {{adv|Crystal}}, and himself from {{p|Lugia}}.

Another Feraligatr is owned by [[Ultima]] who first appeared in ''[[PS280|Some Things Are Better Left Unown]]''.

===In the Pokémon Battrio: Aim to be Battrio Master! manga===
Feraligatr appeared in [[ABM05]].

===In the Pocket Monsters HGSS Jō's Big Adventure manga===
{{main|Jō's Feraligatr}}
Jō owns a Feraligatr who evolved from a Croconaw which was the Totodile he started with.

===In the Pokémon Pocket Monsters manga===
A Feraligatr debuted in ''[[PM082|Don't Accuse Me!!]]'' under the ownership of [[Goldenrod Tunnel|The Underground]] shop owners.

Another one appeared in ''[[PMRS62|Let's Go After The Pokémon Ranger!]]''.

Feraligatr appeared in ''[[PMHGSS01|Participate in the Pokéathlon!!]]'' while at the Pokéathlon.

===In the Pokémon Try Adventure manga===
A Feraligatr appeared in ''[[TA13|Mythical Pokémon]]''.

==Trivia==
* Feraligatr reaches its final evolutionary form earlier than any other starter Pokémon, at level 30. However, {{p|Totodile}} evolves at level 18, the latest of any basic starter Pokémon, tied with {{p|Turtwig}}.
* Feraligatr shares the same base stat values with {{p|Blastoise}}, but differently attributed.
* Feraligatr is the only fully evolved [[Johto]] starter to appear in [[PokéPark Wii: Pikachu's Adventure]].

===Origin===
Like {{p|Totodile}} and {{p|Croconaw}}, Feraligatr is a {{wp|crocodilia}}n. It visually resembles an {{wp|alligator}}.

====Name origin====
Feraligatr is a combination of ''feral'' and ''{{wp|alligator}}''. It may also derive from ''ferocious''. The shortening of "gator" into ''gatr'' is most likely a result of the ten-character limit on English Pokémon names in [[Generation II]].

Ordile may be a combination of 王 ''ō'' (king), 皇 ''ō'' (emperor), or 大 ''ō'' (large), and ''{{wp|crocodile}}''.
